poem:
"Polar Return"

In the stark White Clip of Aurora's reign,
An age, iridescent, hums in snow-soaked veins.
Each frame, a winter's chronicle, tuned and twanged,
Splashed with humor, sadness, wisdom arranged.
A tale of time, in icy script,
Draws laughter, tears, in swift eclipse. 
Graphically, we age, each tale,
A Polar Vortex, fierce and frail.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Polar Vortex by Denise Dorrance review – hazards of a homecoming Denise Dorrance’s graphic memoir, Polar Vortex, is enchanting, every page lovely to look at, so funny and plangent and full of sly wisdom. But it’s also (dread word) strikingly relevant. Its principal subject being old age, by rights it should bring vast crowds of new readers to comics. There can, after all, be few people now who haven’t at least some experience of caring". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
